    • Field Detail

      • ASCII_CHARS

        private static final char[] ASCII_CHARS
        The characters that can be used for rasterizing the image in an ASCII format. These characters are stored in descending order of intensity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Images

        private Images()

    • Method Detail

      • convertToASCII

        public static java.lang.String[] convertToASCII(Context context,
                                                java.awt.Image source,
                                                int outputWidth)
        Given an Image, this method converts that image into an array of Strings, where each string represents a single row of pixels in the output image. Color information is not preserved.
        Parameters:
        source - The source image to translate.
        outputWidth - The number of characters per line in the output image.
        Returns:
        An array of Strings representing the ASCII image.

      • mapToCharacters

        public static Glyph[][] mapToCharacters(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                        ColorSamplingStrategy cs,
                                        int outputWidth,
                                        int charWidth,
                                        int charHeight)

      • constrainText

        public java.lang.String[] constrainText(java.awt.image.BufferedImage source,
                                        java.lang.String text,
                                        int maxWidth)
        For a line of text, this method will constrain that text to the bounds of the source image, assuming that the bounds of the text are calculated from the alpha components of each pixel. The image will be resized to accommodate the maxWidth of the line, so that largest bound is the same.
        Parameters:
        source -
        text -
        maxWidth -
        Returns:

      • toBufferedImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage toBufferedImage(java.awt.Image source)
        Converts an Image into a BufferedImage.
        Parameters:
        source - The input image.
        Returns:
        A writable image identical to the source.

      • resize

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage resize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage original,
                                                  int width,
                                                  int height)

      • convertToGrayscale

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertToGrayscale(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
